DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:49> This image shows coffins of dead Israeli soldiers in September, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:49>)
web_search("protest coffins israel")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/)) and Euronews ([https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages](https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages)) both reported on a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, where demonstrators carried mock coffins draped with Israeli flags to symbolize hostages held by Hamas in Gaza. <image:49> The protesters were demanding the release of the hostages.

A BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c93npgqlzvpo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c93npgqlzvpo)) from February 20, 2025, discusses the return of the bodies of Israeli hostages. <image:11734> <image:11736>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image depicts mock coffins used in a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, as reported by The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/)) and Euronews ([https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages](https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages)). The protesters were demanding the release of hostages held in Gaza.

The claim that the image shows coffins of dead Israeli soldiers is therefore incorrect.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:49> This image shows coffins of dead Israeli soldiers in September, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:49>)
web_search("protest coffins israel")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/)) and Euronews ([https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages](https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages)) both reported on a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, where demonstrators carried mock coffins draped with Israeli flags to symbolize hostages held by Hamas in Gaza. <image:49> The protesters were demanding the release of the hostages.

A BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c93npgqlzvpo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c93npgqlzvpo)) from February 20, 2025, discusses the return of the bodies of Israeli hostages. <image:11734> <image:11736>


## Elaboration
The image depicts mock coffins used in a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, as reported by The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/)) and Euronews ([https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages](https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages)). The protesters were demanding the release of hostages held in Gaza.

The claim that the image shows coffins of dead Israeli soldiers is therefore incorrect.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image shows mock coffins used in a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, not coffins of dead Israeli soldiers. The protest was to demand the release of hostages held in Gaza.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:49> This image shows coffins of dead Israeli soldiers in September, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:49>)
web_search("protest coffins israel")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/)) and Euronews ([https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages](https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages)) both reported on a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, where demonstrators carried mock coffins draped with Israeli flags to symbolize hostages held by Hamas in Gaza. <image:49> The protesters were demanding the release of the hostages.

A BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c93npgqlzvpo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c93npgqlzvpo)) from February 20, 2025, discusses the return of the bodies of Israeli hostages. <image:11734> <image:11736>


## Elaboration
The image depicts mock coffins used in a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, as reported by The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/carrying-fake-coffins-protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-to-demand-hostage-deal/)) and Euronews ([https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages](https://www.euronews.com/2024/09/05/protesters-march-in-tel-aviv-with-makeshift-coffins-to-demand-release-of-gaza-hostages)). The protesters were demanding the release of hostages held in Gaza.

The claim that the image shows coffins of dead Israeli soldiers is therefore incorrect.


## Final Judgement
The image shows mock coffins used in a protest in Tel Aviv on September 5, 2024, not coffins of dead Israeli soldiers. The protest was to demand the release of hostages held in Gaza.

`false`

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()


* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Record
## Claim

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo): 
Content: "Benjamin Netanyahu has promised that Hezbollah will “pay a heavy price which it has not paid up to now”.

Israel Katz, the foreign minister, said Hezbollah’s leader, Hassan Nasrallah, should “pay with his head”, while the far-right finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, warned Israel was approaching all-out war with Hezbollah.

! We don’t seek war – but Hezbollah want to destroy Israel and the Jewish people, so can we just let them do that without defending ourselves?”

Cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon has grown steadily since 8 October, when Hezbollah fired rockets and shells at Israeli sites in solidarity with the Hamas attack on Israel a day earlier. Both groups call for the destruction of the Israeli state.

Frequent attacks by Hezbollah have struck northern Israel and the Golan Heights, which Israel seized from Syria during the 1967 war and annexed in 1981. Following the strike, the Lebanese militants are said to have pre-emptively cleared out some key sites in the south of the country and the eastern Bekaa valley in the anticipation of a large-scale Israeli attack.

Israel’s prime minister returned early from the US to chair a security cabinet meeting, amid calls to hit back hard. The skirmishes had been relatively contained, suggesting both sides were aiming to avoid a head-on confrontation.

*   [Thousands mourn children killed in Golan Heights strike](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cz5rj16ed4lo)
    
*   [Lebanon fears dangerous new phase in Hezbollah-Israel fighting](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c72vg87rzd5o)
    

But now the question is how far Israel will go in response to Saturday’s tragedy, the biggest single loss of life in the cross-border attacks since October.

Thousands lined the streets of the town to mourn the young victims, holding flowers and photos as they crowded beside the small white coffins. Hezbollah says it did not fire the deadly rocket, but the Israeli government insists that’s a lie. <image:11740>!EPA Druze mourners weep over the coffin of one of the victims of a rocket attack from Lebanon, in the village of Majdal Shams (28/07/24) <image:11743>EPA

The strike was the deadliest cross-border attack since fighting escalated in October

Perilous moment
---------------

But Israel knows that the price of such a war with the Lebanese militant group could be devastating – for both sides.

Hezbollah is the strongest non-state actor in the region, with an estimated 150,000 rockets and missiles in its arsenal. It is Iran’s most important proxy in the Middle East – and an attack by Israel could draw in Tehran, which warned Israel that any “new adventures” in Lebanon could lead to “unforeseen consequences”.

And Israeli troops are still stretched in Gaza. Opening up another military front as their munitions run low could simply be unfeasible.

On the other hand, some 60,000 Israelis have been displaced from the border region with Lebanon over the past few months – and many are demanding that their government neutralise the threat from Hezbollah.

And Mr Netanyahu, whose popularity at home is plummeting, is doing all he can for his political survival.

Rocket strike puts Israel and Hezbollah on brink of all-out war

28 July 2024

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack): 
Content: "[Herzi Halevi](/wiki/Herzi_Halevi "Herzi Halevi")
, at the soccer field in Majdal Shams, meeting with Druze community leader Sheikh [Mowafaq Tarif](/wiki/Mowafaq_Tarif "Mowafaq Tarif")
, local council representatives, and senior IDF officers

The IDF Chief of Staff, Lieutenant General [Herzi Halevi](/wiki/Herzi_Halevi "Herzi Halevi")
, visited Majdal Shams to assess the situation and discuss with Sheikh [Mowafaq Tarif](/wiki/Mowafaq_Tarif "Mowafaq Tarif")
, the leader of the Druze community in Israel.[\[49\]](#cite_note-50)

A spokesman for the Israeli Foreign Ministry said that the situation could be resolved without broader conflict if Hezbollah complied with [United Nations Security Council Resolution 1701](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_1701 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 1701")
, which was intended to end the [2006 Lebanon War](/wiki/2006_Lebanon_War "2006 Lebanon War")
 and required that they withdraw behind the [Litani River](/wiki/Litani_River "Litani River")
.[\[50\]](#cite_note-51)

Over 300,000 [shekels](/wiki/Israeli_new_shekel "Israeli new shekel")
 were raised on Sunday by 2,065 people for families in Majdal Shams who lost children in a rocket attack.[\[51\]](#cite_note-52)
 [Israeli Finance Minister](/wiki/Ministry_of_Finance_(Israel) "Ministry of Finance (Israel)")
 [Bezalel Smotrich](/wiki/Bezalel_Smotrich "Bezalel Smotrich")
, who came to visit the site of the attack, was berated by local residents who called him a "criminal" and a "murderer".[\[52\]](#cite_note-53)
 Some Druze residents of the Golan Heights called on Israel to take decisive action against Hezbollah.[\[53\]](#cite_note-Maariv20240728-54)
[\[54\]](#cite_note-Ynet20240728-55)

### 29 July

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Majdal_Shams_29_July_2024_after_the_attack_28_-_Place_of_the_attack.jpg/250px-Majdal_Shams_29_July_2024_after_the_attack_28_-_Place_of_the_attack.jpg)](/wiki/File:Majdal_Shams_29_July_2024_after_the_attack_28_-_Place_of_the_attack.jpg)

, at the monument in Majdal Shams in honor of [Sultan Al-Atrash](/wiki/Sultan_Al-Atrash "Sultan Al-Atrash")
, along with photos of the victims

On 29 July, local residents issued a statement were they rejected any retaliation.[\[56\]](#cite_note-b040-57)

Israeli authorities confirmed the death of 11-year-old Jivara Ibrahim Ibrahim, the 12th victim of the attack. Western sources dismissed this claim, citing expert opinion that the rocket had been fired by Hezbollah or another militant group in Lebanon.[\[7\]](#cite_note-AP-8)

Local authorities denied that the children were Israeli,[\[1\]](#cite_note-Picheta-1)
 and local residents protested the attendance of Israeli ministers at the funeral for reasons ranging from opposition to politicization of the tragedy to anger at the Israeli government's perceived neglect of their safety.[\[11\]](#cite_note-aa1-12)

The attack occurred amid the [Israel–Hezbollah conflict](/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hezbollah_conflict_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Israel–Hezbollah conflict (2023–present)")
 that has been ongoing since 8 October 2023, a regular exchange of attacks that began following the outbreak of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
.[\[16\]](#cite_note-17)

 Hezbollah commander [Fuad Shukr](/wiki/Fuad_Shukr "Fuad Shukr")
.

Background
----------

### Majdal Shams

Further information on the location: [Occupation of the Golan Heights](/wiki/Israeli_occupation_of_the_Golan_Heights "Israeli occupation of the Golan Heights")
 and [United States recognition](/wiki/United_States_recognition_of_the_Golan_Heights_as_part_of_Israel "United States recognition of the Golan Heights as part of Israel")

[Majdal Shams](/wiki/Majdal_Shams "Majdal Shams")
 is a predominantly [Druze](/wiki/Druze "Druze")
 town in the [Israeli-occupied](/wiki/Israeli_occupation "Israeli occupation")
 [Golan Heights](/wiki/Golan_Heights "Golan Heights")
,[\[18\]](#cite_note-19)
[\[19\]](#cite_note-WSJ20240727-20)
 The [Golan Heights](/wiki/Golan_Heights "Golan Heights")
 are a rocky plateau in the [Levant](/wiki/Levant "Levant")
 region of [Western Asia](/wiki/Western_Asia "Western Asia")
 that was captured by [Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 from [Syria](/wiki/Syria "Syria")
 in the 1967 [Six-Day War](/wiki/Six-Day_War "Six-Day War")
. [Herzi Halevi](/wiki/Herzi_Halevi "Herzi Halevi")
 meeting with the Mayor of Majdal Shams, [Dolan Abu Saleh](/w/index.php?title=Dolan_Abu_Saleh&action=edit&redlink=1 "Dolan Abu Saleh (page does not exist)")
 \[[he](https://he.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D7%93%D7%95%D7%9C%D7%90%D7%9F_%D7%90%D7%91%D7%95_%D7%A1%D7%90%D7%9C%D7%97 "he:דולאן אבו סאלח")\
\], at the site of the attack

Following the attack, Israel's military stated that it had launched strikes against Hezbollah weapon storage and infrastructure in Lebanon, specifically in the areas of Chabriha, [Burj el-Shemali](/wiki/Burj_el-Shemali "Burj el-Shemali")
, [Beqaa](/wiki/Beqaa_Valley "Beqaa Valley")
, [Kafr Kila](/wiki/Kafr_Kila,_Lebanon "Kafr Kila, Lebanon")
, [Khiam](/wiki/Khiam "Khiam")
, [Rab El Thalathine](/wiki/Rab_El_Thalathine "Rab El Thalathine")
, and [Tayr Harfa](/wiki/Tayr_Harfa "Tayr Harfa")
.[\[45\]](#cite_note-46)
[\[17\]](#cite_note-WashingtonPost20240728-18)
 The IDF also said that it struck the launch site of the projectile with [artillery](/wiki/Artillery "Artillery")
.[\[46\]](#cite_note-47)

### 28 July

On 28 July, Lebanon's foreign minister, [Abdallah Bou Habib](/wiki/Abdallah_Bou_Habib "Abdallah Bou Habib")
, said that the Lebanese government had requested that the US urge Israel to show restraint, and added that the US had also asked Lebanon to relay a message to Hezbollah to exercise restraint.[\[47\]](#cite_note-48)
 Hezbollah, reported to be on high alert, preemptively evacuated key sites in southern Lebanon and the Beqaa Valley in anticipation of a possible Israeli response.[\[48\]](#cite_note-49)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6e/Majdal_Shams_attack%2C_July_2024%2C_XIV.jpg/250px-Majdal_Shams_attack%2C_July_2024%2C_XIV.jpg)](/wiki/File:Majdal_Shams_attack,_July_2024,_XIV.jpg)

IDF Chief of Staff, Lt. He stated that while the conflict would come at a significant cost, the goal is to decisively defeat Hezbollah and restore peace, and he has directed the Foreign Ministry to prepare a global campaign to support actions in Lebanon.[\[6\]](#cite_note-Ynetnews20240727-7)
        
    *   [Minister of Energy](/wiki/Ministry_of_Energy_(Israel) "Ministry of Energy (Israel)")
         [Eli Cohen](/wiki/Eli_Cohen_(politician,_born_1972) "Eli Cohen (politician, born 1972)")
         said that "Lebanon should burn" after the attack.[\[73\]](#cite_note-74)
        

### Lebanon

*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Flag_of_Lebanon.svg/40px-Flag_of_Lebanon.svg.png)[Lebanon](/wiki/Lebanon "Lebanon")
    : The government of Lebanon issued a statement urging "immediate cessation of hostilities on all fronts" and condemned attacks on civilians but did not mention Majdal Shams.[\[29\]](#cite_note-APNews20240728-30)
     Lebanese Druze politician [Wiam Wahhab](/wiki/Wiam_Wahhab "Wiam Wahhab")
     said that Druze "blood is not cheap," and called for an independent investigation into the Majdal Shams massacre.[\[30\]](#cite_note-TimesOfIsrael20240728-31)
    *    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/InfoboxHez.PNG/40px-InfoboxHez.PNG)[Hezbollah](/wiki/Hezbollah "Hezbollah")
        : Hezbollah said it had carried out nine attacks using rockets and suicide drones against IDF targets including Maaleh Golani in response to Israeli airstrikes but denied Majdal Shams had been targeted.[\[29\]](#cite_note-APNews20240728-30)
        
    *   Druze [Member of Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Lebanon "Parliament of Lebanon")
        , [Wael Abu Faour](/wiki/Wael_Abu_Faour "Wael Abu Faour")
         said: "The Israeli occupation state weeps over the children martyrs from the occupied Syrian Golan Heights — this is the height of obscenity and hypocrisy," and "Today, they cry over them to incite discord between them and their Arab and Islamic brethren, while war criminal Netanyahu wants to use the Golan tragedy to overturn any negotiations and continue his aggressive war on the Palestinian people"[\[74\]](#cite_note-q442-75)
         Faour also compared the victims in Majdal Shams to those killed by Israel in the [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip "Gaza Strip")
        .[\[74\]](#cite_note-q442-75)
        
    *   Druze leader of the [Lebanese Democratic Party](/wiki/Lebanese_Democratic_Party "Lebanese Democratic Party")
        , [Talal Arslan](/wiki/Talal_Arslan "Talal Arslan")
        , said: "The Golan will not fall into the trap of Israel's project to pretend to protect minorities"[\[74\]](#cite_note-q442-75)
        
    *   Ahmad Qabalan, Lebanon's Grand [Ja'fari](/wiki/Ja%27fari_school "Ja'fari school")
         Mufti, said: "To the Druze brothers in Lebanon, Syria, and Palestine: our blood, spirit, and struggle are unified, and so is our enemy. No one has paid the price for liberating the Golan and Palestine as the resistance has."[\[74\]](#cite_note-q442-75)
        

### Syria

*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Flag_of_the_United_Arab_Republic_%281958%E2%80%931971%29%2C_Flag_of_Syria_%281980%E2%80%932024%29.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_Arab_Republic_%281958%E2%80%931971%29%2C_Flag_of_Syria_%281980%E2%80%932024%29.svg.png)[Syria](/wiki/Ba%27athist_Syria "Ba'athist Syria")
    : The [Council of Ministers](/wiki/Council_of_Ministers_(Syria) "Council of Ministers (Syria)")
     issued condolences to the people of Majdal Shams and condemned the attack stating: "this crime, is an attempt to fabricate lies and pretexts to expand the circle of aggression against the peoples of the region and to escape the impasse resulting from the resistance that this occupation is facing in the Gaza Strip."[\[75\]](#cite_note-76)
    *   The [Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party](/wiki/Arab_Socialist_Ba%27ath_Party_%E2%80%93_Syria_Region "Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party – Syria Region")
         issued a statement: "Through this aggression, Zionist entity tried to mislead world public opinion by accusing Lebanese Hezbollah resistance of committing this act with the aim of igniting sedition".[\[76\]](#cite_note-y678-77)
         They also condemned Israel for the attack.[\[76\]](#cite_note-y678-77)
        
    *   SANA reported that Syria's [Foreign Affairs and Expatriates Minister](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_and_Expatriates_(Syria) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates (Syria)")
        , [Faisal Mekdad](/wiki/Faisal_Mekdad "Faisal Mekdad")
         "stressed Syria’s legitimate right to recover the occupied Golan, denouncing the heinous crime committed by the occupation forces on Saturday in Majdal Shams town." He also asked for the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations")
         to intervene against Israels actions against Syrians in the Golan Heights.[\[77\]](#cite_note-t897-78)
        

### Druze communities

[![Druze](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Flag_of_Druze.svg/40px-Flag_of_Druze.svg.png)](/wiki/Druze "Druze")
 The attack provoked widespread outrage among [Druze](/wiki/Druze "Druze")
 in Israel, Lebanon and Syria.[\[78\]](#cite_note-79)

#### Golan Heights

The Druze community in the Golan Heights sent a letter to the Israeli government asking that no government ministers attend the funeral.[\[11\]](#cite_note-aa1-12)
 The funeral was kept non-political, with no national flags, and a Druze resident stated "Many Druze feel angry and do not want to be fuel in this war for any side".[\[79\]](#cite_note-80)
 A local paramedic stated "for sure, it was not targeting Majdal Shams. We can afford to be silent when children sleep quietly, but when they die in a treacherous bombing delivered by the party of the devil, we must raise our voices against the gang that rules here."[\[82\]](#cite_note-83)

### Worldwide

#### Governments

*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png)[Argentina](/wiki/Argentina "Argentina")
    : The [Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs,_International_Trade_and_Worship "Ministry of Foreign Affairs, International Trade and Worship")
     stated strong condemnation for "the cowardly attack by Hezbollah" and solidarity with Israel and support for Israel's right to legitimate defense; while pointing the 30th anniversary of the [AMIA bombing](/wiki/AMIA_bombing "AMIA bombing")
     in Argentina which was also reportedly perpetrated by Hezbollah, to once again reiterate its strongest condemnation of all forms of terrorism.[\[83\]](#cite_note-84)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Flag_of_Canada_%28Pantone%29.svg/40px-Flag_of_Canada_%28Pantone%29.svg.png)[Canada](/wiki/Canada "Canada")
    : Foreign Minister [Mélanie Joly](/wiki/M%C3%A9lanie_Joly "Mélanie Joly")
     condemned the attack and offered condolences to the victims' families and the Druze community. Retrieved 28 July 2024.

<br>*   [Ibrahim Aqil](/wiki/Ibrahim_Aqil "Ibrahim Aqil")<br>    <br><br>Related topics<br><br>*   [Iran–Israel proxy conflict](/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_proxy_conflict "Iran–Israel proxy conflict")<br>    <br>*   [Hezbollah–Israel conflict](/wiki/Hezbollah%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "Hezbollah–Israel conflict") |     |

The **Majdal Shams attack**, took place on 27 July 2024, when a rocket hit a [football pitch](/wiki/Football_pitch "Football pitch")
 in [Majdal Shams](/wiki/Majdal_Shams "Majdal Shams")
 in the [Israeli-occupied](/wiki/Israeli-occupied_territories "Israeli-occupied territories")
 [Golan Heights](/wiki/Golan_Heights "Golan Heights")
.[\[a\]](#cite_note-5)
 The resulting blast killed 12 [Syrian](/wiki/Syrians "Syrians")
 children belonging to the [Druze](/wiki/Druze "Druze")
 community[\[1\]](#cite_note-Picheta-1)
[\[2\]](#cite_note-Bulos-2)
[\[3\]](#cite_note-muddi-3)
 and injured at least 42 others,[\[5\]](#cite_note-TOI27July-6)
[\[6\]](#cite_note-Ynetnews20240727-7)
 with most of the victims being between the ages of 10 and 16.[\[5\]](#cite_note-TOI27July-6)
[\[1\]](#cite_note-Picheta-1)

[Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 blamed [Hezbollah](/wiki/Hezbollah "Hezbollah")
 for carrying out the attack with an Iranian-made [Falaq-1](/wiki/Falaq-1 "Falaq-1")
 rocket equipped with a 53-kilogram warhead.[\[5\]](#cite_note-TOI27July-6)
[\[7\]](#cite_note-AP-8)
 Hezbollah said it had targeted a nearby military base and that the football pitch was hit by an errant Israeli [Iron Dome](/wiki/Iron_Dome "Iron Dome")
 [air defence](/wiki/Air_defence "Air defence")
 projectile. The international community, with the exception of Israel and the United States, considers the Golan Heights to be Syrian territory held by Israel under [military occupation](/wiki/Military_occupation "Military occupation")
.[\[20\]](#cite_note-21)

### Israel–Hezbollah conflict

Further information on current conflict: [Israel–Hezbollah conflict](/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hezbollah_conflict "Israel–Hezbollah conflict")
 and [Israel–Gaza conflict](/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Gaza_conflict "Israel–Gaza conflict")

Following the [7 October attack](/wiki/2023_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel "2023 Hamas-led attack on Israel")
, Hezbollah joined the conflict the next day, launching guided rockets and drone attacks at Israeli communities and military installations in [Galilee](/wiki/Galilee "Galilee")
 and the Golan Heights."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the Majdal Shams attack that occurred on July 27, 2024, in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights. The attack, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, resulted in the deaths of 12 Syrian Druze children and injured at least 42 others. <image:51> The article also mentions that the attack took place amid the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:51> This image shows Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich, who previously threatened to invade Lebanon, taking shelter in an Israeli bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on Israel on August 25, 2024."

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/): 
Content: "Mourners shouted at government officials at the funerals, the Times of Israel reported, with one man yelling "get him out of here" to far-right finance minister Bezalel Smotrich.

"There is no doubt that Hezbollah has crossed all the red lines here, and the response will reflect that," Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz told Israeli Channel 12. official told CBS News that Saturday had been a busy day of "almost all-out war" between Israel and Hezbollah. 

Last week, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met [separately with President Biden](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/biden-netanyahu-speech-meeting-israel-hamas-war/)
 and Vice President Kamala Harris, the presumptive Democratic nominee, and also [visited the Republican nominee](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/donald-trump-meets-benjamin-netanyahu-mar-a-lago-florida/)
, former President Donald Trump, at Mar-a-Lago.Harris' national security adviser, Phil Gordon, said on social media Sunday that the vice president had been briefed and is closely monitoring the situation.

"She condemns this horrific attack and mourns for all those killed and wounded," he added.

White House officials have feared a "nightmare scenario" of an errant rocket or missile causing unintended consequences such as mass casualties and forcing a heavier Israeli response.

Biden White House officials have been working the phones trying to de-escalate and contain the response.  But U.S. Israel's military said its air force targeted a Hezbollah arms depot in the border village of Kfar Kila, adding that militants were inside at the time.

Hezbollah said its fighters carried out 10 different attacks using rockets and explosive drones against Israeli military posts, the last of which targeted the army command of the Haramoun Brigade in Maaleh Golani with Katyusha rockets. In recent weeks, the exchange of fire along the Lebanon-Israel border has intensified, with Israeli airstrikes and rocket and drone attacks by Hezbollah striking deeper and farther away from the border.

Majdal Shams had not been among border communities ordered to evacuate as tensions rose, Israel's military said, without saying why. On the Israeli side, 45 have been killed, at least 21 of them soldiers.

_Margaret Brennan and Eleanor Watson contributed reporting._

! calls for restraint after deadly Hezbollah rocket attack in Golan Heights 02:07](https://www.cbsnews.com/video/u-s-calls-for-restraint-after-deadly-hezbollah-rocket-attack-in-golan-heights/)

The U.S. blamed Hezbollah for a rocket attack a day earlier on a Golan Heights soccer field that [killed at least 12 children and teens](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-rocket-attack-israel-hezbollah/)
, sparking fears of a broader conflict in the region. 

U.S. National Security Council spokeswoman Adrienne Watson said in a statement Sunday that the rocket was a Hezbollah rocket and "launched from an area they control." Hezbollah has denied responsibility. 

Israel's military confirmed it had launched airstrikes against Hezbollah targets "deep inside Lebanese territory." 

The airstrikes were apparent retaliation for Saturday's rocket strike, which Israeli military's chief spokesman, Rear Adm."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The CBS News article discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field. The article mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich and the reactions to the attacks. <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:51> This image shows Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich, who previously threatened to invade Lebanon, taking shelter in an Israeli bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on Israel on August 25, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:51>)
web_search("Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich bomb shelter Hezbollah attack")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo): 
Content: The BBC News article, published on July 28, 2024, discusses the escalating cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon, mentioning the involvement of Hezbollah and the potential for all-out war. It quotes Israeli officials, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, and highlights the impact of the attacks, including the displacement of Israelis and the recent rocket strike. <image:11740>, <image:11743>


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack): 
Content: The Wikipedia article discusses the Majdal Shams attack that occurred on July 27, 2024, in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights. The attack, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, resulted in the deaths of 12 Syrian Druze children and injured at least 42 others. <image:51> The article also mentions that the attack took place amid the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict.


From [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/): 
Content: The CBS News article discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field. The article mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich and the reactions to the attacks. <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo)) discusses the escalating cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon, mentioning Hezbollah and Israeli officials, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, and the impact of the attacks. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack)) discusses the Majdal Shams attack on July 27, 2024, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, and mentions the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict. The CBS News article ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/)) discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field, and mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. <image:11740>, <image:11743>, <image:51>, <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:51> This image shows Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich, who previously threatened to invade Lebanon, taking shelter in an Israeli bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on Israel on August 25, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:51>)
web_search("Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich bomb shelter Hezbollah attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo)) discusses the escalating cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon, mentioning Hezbollah and Israeli officials, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, and the impact of the attacks. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack)) discusses the Majdal Shams attack on July 27, 2024, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, and mentions the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict. The CBS News article ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/)) discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field, and mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. <image:11740>, <image:11743>, <image:51>, <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that Bezalel Smotrich is the Israeli Finance Minister and that there have been attacks between Israel and Hezbollah. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during a Hezbollah attack on August 25, 2024. The provided articles do not mention the specific date or location.

Therefore, the claim cannot be fully verified due to a lack of information regarding the image's context and the specific date of the event.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:51> This image shows Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich, who previously threatened to invade Lebanon, taking shelter in an Israeli bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on Israel on August 25, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:51>)
web_search("Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich bomb shelter Hezbollah attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo)) discusses the escalating cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon, mentioning Hezbollah and Israeli officials, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, and the impact of the attacks. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack)) discusses the Majdal Shams attack on July 27, 2024, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, and mentions the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict. The CBS News article ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/)) discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field, and mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. <image:11740>, <image:11743>, <image:51>, <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Bezalel Smotrich is the Israeli Finance Minister and that there have been attacks between Israel and Hezbollah. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during a Hezbollah attack on August 25, 2024. The provided articles do not mention the specific date or location.

Therefore, the claim cannot be fully verified due to a lack of information regarding the image's context and the specific date of the event.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that Bezalel Smotrich is the Israeli Finance Minister and that there have been attacks between Israel and Hezbollah. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during a Hezbollah attack on August 25, 2024. The provided articles do not mention the specific date or location.

The claim is not fully verifiable because the evidence does not confirm the image's context and the specific date of the event. `not enough information`

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

! The photo was accompanied by the following text: “The extremist Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich was the first to flee to shelters,” indicating that the photo was taken at the same time as Hezbollah’s recent bombing of sites in Israel. 

! While Hezbollah announced today that it launched a large-scale attack targeting military sites in the occupying state with a large number of missiles and drones.

Share. <image:11772>

The photo circulated via the “Al-Qastal News” account on “X” on 7 October 2023

[The Israeli occupation army](https://aawsat.com/%D8%B4%D8%A4%D9%88%D9%86-%D8%A5%D9%82%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%A9/5053926-%D8%A5%D8%B3%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%8A%D9%84-%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%86-%D8%B6%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%A8%D8%A7%D9%82%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%84%D8%A8%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86-%D9%84%D9%85%D9%86%D8%B9-%D9%87%D8%AC%D9%88%D9%85-%D9%83%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%B1-%D9%84%D9%80%D8%AD%D8%B2%D8%A8-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%84%D9%87)
  announced today, Sunday, 25 August 2024, that it launched preemptive strikes on southern Lebanon. <image:11759>

One source of the claim

Kashif verified the image and found it to be old, as it was published by a group of [media outlets](https://www.almayadeen.net/news/politics/%D8%B7%D9%88%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%89-%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%84-%D8%A5%D8%B3%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%8A%D9%84-%D9%88%D9%88%D8%B2%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AD%D8%AA%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AC%D8%A6)
 and [news websites](https://x.com/AlQastalps/status/1710727609611366503)
 on October 7th. 

[At the time, the media](https://www.almayadeen.net/news/politics/%D8%B7%D9%88%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%89-%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%84-%D8%A5%D8%B3%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%8A%D9%84-%D9%88%D9%88%D8%B2%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AD%D8%AA%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AC%D8%A6)
 and [news websites](https://x.com/AlQastalps/status/1710727609611366503)
 quoted the Hebrew channel Kan as saying that the ministers of the Israeli occupation government rushed to shelters after sirens sounded in Tel Aviv during a government session. 

!"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Kashif.ps, published on August 25, 2024, discusses an image of Israeli ministers in a shelter, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. The article states that the photo was shared on social media with the claim that it was taken during Hezbollah's recent bombing of sites in Israel. However, Kashif.ps verified that the image is old and was published on October 7, 2023. <image:51>, <image:11772>, <image:11759>

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:51> This image shows Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich, who previously threatened to invade Lebanon, taking shelter in an Israeli bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on Israel on August 25, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:51>)
web_search("Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich bomb shelter Hezbollah attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo)) discusses the escalating cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon, mentioning Hezbollah and Israeli officials, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, and the impact of the attacks. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack)) discusses the Majdal Shams attack on July 27, 2024, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, and mentions the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict. The CBS News article ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/)) discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field, and mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. <image:11740>, <image:11743>, <image:51>, <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Bezalel Smotrich is the Israeli Finance Minister and that there have been attacks between Israel and Hezbollah. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during a Hezbollah attack on August 25, 2024. The provided articles do not mention the specific date or location.

Therefore, the claim cannot be fully verified due to a lack of information regarding the image's context and the specific date of the event.


## Actions
```
web_search("Bezalel Smotrich bomb shelter August 25 2024 Hezbollah")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2024/aug/05/joe-biden-iran-israel-gaza-jordan-latest-middle-east-crisis-live): 
Content: "
>   
> I also remind citizens to avoid travel to Lebanon.
> 
> — Micheál Martin (@MichealMartinTD) [August 5, 2024](https://twitter.com/MichealMartinTD/status/1820417004290871609?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

**The World Health Organisation has delivered 32 tons of medical supplies to [Lebanon](https://www.theguardian.com/world/lebanon)
 in anticipation of a potential full-scale conflict in the Middle East.**

“The goal is to get these supplies and medicines to various hospitals and to the health sector in Lebanon, especially in the places most exposed \[to hostilities\] so that we can be ready to deal with any emergency,” said Lebanese health minister Firass Abiad.

Last week, the Israeli military killed a senior commander of Lebanese militant group [Hezbollah](https://www.theguardian.com/world/hezbollah)
 and Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated in Tehran, sparking fears of a wider regional war.

Thousands of people are leaving Lebanon with the British government advising its citizens to flee the country “while commercial routes are still available”.

**The Israeli defence secretary, Yoav Gallant, met with US secretary of defence Lloyd Austin overnight to discuss Israel’s preparation for an expected Iranian retaliatory attack.**

The president of [Iran](https://www.theguardian.com/world/iran)
, Masoud Pezeshkian, has said the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran was a “major mistake by the Zionist regime \[Israel\] that will not go unanswered”.

According to a statement from the Israeli defence secretary’s team, Gallant briefed Austin on the “security developments in the region and IDF readiness to defend Israel against potential threats posed by Iran and its proxies”.

“He \[Gallant\] discussed a series of scenarios and corresponding defensive and offensive capabilities” and “expressed his appreciation to Secretary Austin for the close military and strategic coordination between Israel and the United States, including the current and future deployment of US military capabilities and force posture changes in defence of Israel”.

Gallant also stressed the importance of “US leadership in forming a coalition of allies and partners to defend Israel and the region from a range of aerial attacks”.

**Israel’s finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, has said it is “justified and moral” to let two million civilians in Gaza die of hunger unless Israeli hostages are returned****.**

Speaking at a press conference in Israel, Smotrich complained that international pressure meant the government had “no choice” but to bring in aid.

The far-right politician argued that the main factor extending the war was aid sustaining Hamas, and that the Israeli government must regain full control over what enters [Gaza](https://www.theguardian.com/world/gaza)
. “No one has the right to doubt Iran’s legal right to punish the Zionist regime,” said Kanaani.
    
*   **Israel’s finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, said it is “justified and moral” to let two million civilians in Gaza die of hunger unless Israeli hostages are returned****.** Speaking at a press conference in Israel, Smotrich complained that international pressure meant the government had “no choice” but to bring in aid.
    
*   **Nearly half of Hamas’ military battalions in Gaza have revived some of their fighting capabilities, according to a [CNN special report](https://edition.cnn.com/interactive/2024/08/middleeast/gaza-israel-hamas-battalions-invs-intl/)
    , despite Netanyahu’s claims that Israeli forces are near their intended goal of eliminating Hamas.** Speaking to Congress on 24 July, Netanyahu said, “Victory is in sight.” But analyses by the American Enterprise Institute’s Critical Threats Project, the Institute for the Study of War and CNN show that despite the heavy bombardment of the Strip at least eight battalions remain combat effective.
    
*   **Israel has handed over 80 unidentified Palestinian bodies to the Gaza’s civil defence agency, according to Gazan officials.** Gaza’s civil defence director Yamen Abu Suleiman told AFP that no information was provided with the bodies, and so there is no clear idea where they came from. Live feed
---------

From 5 Aug 2024

The Lebanese militant group [Hezbollah](https://www.theguardian.com/world/hezbollah)
 has hit northern Israel in a drone attack in response to what it called “attacks and assassinations” carried out by Israel in several villages in south Lebanon. The Israeli military says the attack wounded two soldiers and set off a fire.

The violence came amid fears of an all-out war after the killing of a senior Hezbollah commander in [Lebanon](https://www.theguardian.com/world/lebanon)
 and Hamas’s political leader in Iran.

The Hezbollah attack appears more in keeping with ongoing border skirmishes, rather than as a direct response to the political assassinations.

The Israeli military said fire services were working to put out a fire that was ignited as a result of the attack in Ayelet HaShahar in the upper Galilee.

    Punishing Israel is necessary, says Iran’s foreign ministry spokesperson](?filterKeyEvents=false&page=with%3Ablock-66b0868b8f08cbd70fce1148#block-66b0868b8f08cbd70fce1148)
    
*   [5 Aug 2024\
    \
    Hezbollah launches drone attack on northern Israel](?filterKeyEvents=false&page=with%3Ablock-66b07c208f08fd552e83044f#block-66b07c208f08fd552e83044f)
    
*   [5 Aug 2024\
    \
    Opening summary](?filterKeyEvents=false&page=with%3Ablock-66b006a88f08cbd70fce0e31#block-66b006a88f08cbd70fce0e31)
    

Show key events only

Please turn on JavaScript to use this feature

*   **Two people are dead in south Lebanon as a result of an Israel strike on Monday, according to Lebanon’s health ministry.** One of those killed was a paramedic, according to Ali Abbas, a rescue worker who spoke to AFP.
    
*   **The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah hit northern Israel in a drone attack early on Monday, in response to what it called “attacks and assassinations” carried out by Israel in several villages in south Lebanon.** The Israeli military says the attack wounded two soldiers and set off a fire.
    
*   **Nasser Kanaani, Iran’s foreign ministry spokesperson, said Tehran was not looking to escalate tensions but punishment was ‘“necessary” as a response to the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh and to prevent further instability**. Thanks for following along.

**Israel has handed over 80 unidentified Palestinian bodies to the Gaza’s civil defence agency, according to Gazan officials.**

“We received 80 bodies inside 15 bags, with more than four martyrs in each bag, each wrapped in a single shroud,” Gaza’s civil defence director Yamen Abu Suleiman told AFP.

Abu Suleiman said no information was provided with the bodies, and so there is no clear idea where they came from.

“We do not know if they are martyrs \[killed in Gaza\] or prisoners from \[Israel’s\] jails,” he added.

The bodies were buried at the Turkish cemetery, near Khan Yunis, the main city in the southern part of Gaza, AFP journalists said.

**Nearly half of Hamas’ military battalions in Gaza have revived some of their fighting capabilities, according to a [CNN special report](https://edition.cnn.com/interactive/2024/08/middleeast/gaza-israel-hamas-battalions-invs-intl/)
, despite Netanyahu’s claims that Israeli forces are near their intended goal of eliminating Hamas.**

Speaking to Congress on 24 July, Netanyahu said, “Victory is in sight.” But analyses by the American Enterprise Institute’s Critical Threats Project, the Institute for the Study of War and CNN show that despite the heavy bombardment of the Strip at least eight battalions remain combat effective. 
>   
> Thank you Minister, for your solidarity, leadership, and firm stance…
> 
> — יואב גלנט - Yoav Gallant (@yoavgallant) [August 5, 2024](https://twitter.com/yoavgallant/status/1820423209889480997?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Iran’s foreign ministry has called in ambassadors and heads of missions for a meeting with the country’s acting foreign minister, **Ali Bagheri Kani**, to reiterate Iran’s will to respond to [Israel](https://www.theguardian.com/world/israel)
, Reuters reports.

Spain’s foreign minister, **José Manuel Albares**, has spoken with his Jordanian counterpart, **Ayman Safadi**, about the risk of escalation in the Middle East.

> He hablado con mi colega jordano [@AymanHsafadi](https://twitter.com/AymanHsafadi?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
>  sobre el riesgo de escalada en Oriente Medio y la necesidad de realizar todos los esfuerzos posibles para impedir la extensión regional violencia. Es necesario acuerdo de alto el fuego que detenga esta espiral y evitar más muertes.
> 
> — José Manuel Albares (@jmalbares) [August 5, 2024](https://twitter.com/jmalbares/status/1820406158873546844?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Ireland’s foreign minister, **Micheál Martin**, has asked citizens to avoid travel to [Israel](https://www.theguardian.com/world/israel)
.

> We have updated our travel  
> advice for Israel. Military spokesman Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari said there was “no change in the Home Front Command’s defence policy” but that Israel’s protection was not “hermetic”.
    
*   **Israeli airstrikes [hit two schools and a hospital complex](https://on%20two%20schools%20in%20gaza%20city%20killed%20at%20least%2025%20people%20sheltering%20there%20on%20sunday,%20and%20another%20attack%20on%20the%20courtyard%20of%20al-aqsa%20hospital%20killed%20at%20least%20five%20people%20and%20set%20the%20tents%20of%20displaced%20people%20on%20fire./)
     in Gaza on Sunday, killing at least 30 people**. The attacks on two schools in Gaza City killed at least 25 people sheltering there on Sunday, and another attack on the courtyard of al-Aqsa hospital killed at least five people and set the tents of displaced people on fire.
    
*   **The toll from the war in Gaza reached 39,580 on Sunday, the territory’s health authorities said.** Not all the dead have been identified, but civilians make up a majority of the 25,000 who have been named."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Guardian published an article on August 5, 2024, discussing the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, including a drone attack on northern Israel by Hezbollah. The article mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich and his statements regarding the situation in Gaza. The article also reports on the delivery of medical supplies to Lebanon by the World Health Organisation. <image:51> is included in the article.

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:51> This image shows Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich, who previously threatened to invade Lebanon, taking shelter in an Israeli bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on Israel on August 25, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:51>)
web_search("Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich bomb shelter Hezbollah attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo)) discusses the escalating cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon, mentioning Hezbollah and Israeli officials, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, and the impact of the attacks. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack)) discusses the Majdal Shams attack on July 27, 2024, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, and mentions the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict. The CBS News article ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/)) discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field, and mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. <image:11740>, <image:11743>, <image:51>, <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Bezalel Smotrich is the Israeli Finance Minister and that there have been attacks between Israel and Hezbollah. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during a Hezbollah attack on August 25, 2024. The provided articles do not mention the specific date or location.

Therefore, the claim cannot be fully verified due to a lack of information regarding the image's context and the specific date of the event.


## Actions
```
web_search("Bezalel Smotrich bomb shelter August 25 2024 Hezbollah")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/08/25/old-photo-of-israeli-ministers-in-shelter-republished-as-during-hezbollahs-recent-bombing-of-sites-in-israel/): 
Content: The article from Kashif.ps, published on August 25, 2024, discusses an image of Israeli ministers in a shelter, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. The article states that the photo was shared on social media with the claim that it was taken during Hezbollah's recent bombing of sites in Israel. However, Kashif.ps verified that the image is old and was published on October 7, 2023. <image:51>, <image:11772>, <image:11759>


From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2024/aug/05/joe-biden-iran-israel-gaza-jordan-latest-middle-east-crisis-live): 
Content: The Guardian published an article on August 5, 2024, discussing the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, including a drone attack on northern Israel by Hezbollah. The article mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich and his statements regarding the situation in Gaza. The article also reports on the delivery of medical supplies to Lebanon by the World Health Organisation. <image:51> is included in the article.

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.

* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim

The CBS News article ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/)) discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field, and mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. <image:11740>, <image:11743>, <image:51>, <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>

However, the evidence does not confirm that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during a Hezbollah attack on August 25, 2024. This suggests that the claim is likely false, as the image is not from the specific event described in the claim.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is an old photo that was republished during recent events. The claim that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on August 25, 2024, is therefore not accurate.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:51> This image shows Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich, who previously threatened to invade Lebanon, taking shelter in an Israeli bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on Israel on August 25, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:51>)
web_search("Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich bomb shelter Hezbollah attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c2e4m6m1r4eo)) discusses the escalating cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon, mentioning Hezbollah and Israeli officials, including Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, and the impact of the attacks. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Majdal_Shams_attack)) discusses the Majdal Shams attack on July 27, 2024, which Israel blamed on Hezbollah, and mentions the ongoing Israel–Hezbollah conflict. The CBS News article ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golan-heights-attack-israel-hezbollah-airstrikes/)) discusses the recent attacks between Israel and Hezbollah, including a rocket attack on a Golan Heights soccer field, and mentions Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich. <image:11740>, <image:11743>, <image:51>, <image:11747>, <image:11748>, <image:11750>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Bezalel Smotrich is the Israeli Finance Minister and that there have been attacks between Israel and Hezbollah. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during a Hezbollah attack on August 25, 2024. The provided articles do not mention the specific date or location.

Therefore, the claim cannot be fully verified due to a lack of information regarding the image's context and the specific date of the event.


## Actions
```
web_search("Bezalel Smotrich bomb shelter August 25 2024 Hezbollah")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The article from Kashif.ps ([https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/08/25/old-photo-of-israeli-ministers-in-shelter-republished-as-during-hezbollahs-recent-bombing-of-sites-in-israel/](https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/08/25/old-photo-of-israeli-ministers-in-shelter-republished-as-during-hezbollahs-recent-bombing-of-sites-in-israel/)) states that the image <image:51>

## Elaboration
The Kashif.ps article ([https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/08/25/old-photo-of-israeli-ministers-in-shelter-republished-as-during-hezbollahs-recent-bombing-of-sites-in-israel/](https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/08/25/old-photo-of-israeli-ministers-in-shelter-republished-as-during-hezbollahs-recent-bombing-of-sites-in-israel/)) indicates that the image is an old photo, and it was republished during the recent bombing of sites in Israel by Hezbollah.

This suggests that the claim is likely false, as the image is not from the specific event described in the claim.


## Final Judgement
The image is an old photo that was republished during recent events. The claim that the image shows Smotrich in a bomb shelter during Hezbollah's attack on August 25, 2024, is therefore not accurate.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. The image is an old photo, as indicated by the Kashif.ps article ([https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/08/25/old-photo-of-israeli-ministers-in-shelter-republished-as-during-hezbollahs-recent-bombing-of-sites-in-israel/](https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/08/25/old-photo-of-israeli-ministers-in-shelter-republished-as-during-hezbollahs-recent-bombing-of-sites-in-israel/)), and was republished during recent events, not specifically on August 25, 2024.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```
